object.content: @sundew We don't have any list of approved models, but VDSL SFP modules are recognized as copper SFP modules and RouterOS does not take any part in DSL monitoring or connectivity. It is known that they work on MIPS-BE devices, but we currently cannot provide more up to date info, we have not tested any, since VDSL is not used in this part of the world. Maybe you can ask other users in our Discord or Forum?

contentMap.en: @sundew We don't have any list of approved models, but VDSL SFP modules are recognized as copper SFP modules and RouterOS does not take any part in DSL monitoring or connectivity. It is known that they work on MIPS-BE devices, but we currently cannot provide more up to date info, we have not tested any, since VDSL is not used in this part of the world. Maybe you can ask other users in our Discord or Forum?

object.content: @bobdvb yep, you can use this as backup power. It will work from the highest Voltage source and seemlessly switch to the other, when first one disappears. This is supported on most mikrotik devices.

contentMap.en: @bobdvb yep, you can use this as backup power. It will work from the highest Voltage source and seemlessly switch to the other, when first one disappears. This is supported on most mikrotik devices.
